alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 05 at 2:54PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...High River Flows and Flooding due to Snowmelt... Despite cooler temperatures yesterday and today, rivers and streams are expected to continue running high as warm temperatures have melted much of the valley and foothills snowpack, which is making its way into the main stem rivers. Local emergency management reported widespread low-land flooding near the Bear River and Salt River, with smaller tributary streams running high as well. Currently, flooding is mainly affecting low-lying agricultural areas. Streams are generally expected to level off today, but remain high into early next week. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain, there are hundreds of low water crossings which can be affected by increased stream flows. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
